type ReferenceCollectionBuilder<'PrincipalEntity, 'DependentEntity (requires 'PrincipalEntity : null and 'DependentEntity : null)> = class inherit ReferenceCollectionBuilder

Docs.typeparam: The principal entity type in this relationship.
The dependent entity type in this relationship.
Docs.summary: Provides a simple API for configuring a one-to-many relationship.

remarks.para: Instances of this class are returned from methods when using the API and it is not designed to be directly constructed in your application code.
See Modeling entity types and relationships for more information and examples.

Docs.summary: Adds or updates an annotation on the relationship. If an annotation with the key specified in already exists its value will be updated.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<TPrincipalEntity,TDependentEntity> HasForeignKey (System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<TDependentEntity,object>> foreignKeyExpression);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder`2<!TPrincipalEntity, !TDependentEntity> HasForeignKey(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<!TDependentEntity, object>> foreignKeyExpression) cil managed
Public Overridable Function HasForeignKey (foreignKeyExpression As Expression(Of Func(Of TDependentEntity, Object))) As ReferenceCollectionBuilder(Of TPrincipalEntity, TDependentEntity)

override this.HasForeignKey : System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<'DependentEntity, obj>> -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<'PrincipalEntity, 'DependentEntity (requires 'PrincipalEntity : null and 'DependentEntity : null)>

public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<TPrincipalEntity,TDependentEntity> HasForeignKey (System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<TDependentEntity,object?>> foreignKeyExpression);

param.name: foreignKeyExpression
param.para: A lambda expression representing the foreign key property(s) (post => post.BlogId).

If the foreign key is made up of multiple properties then specify an anonymous type including the properties (comment => new { comment.BlogId, comment.PostTitle }). The order specified should match the order of corresponding properties in .

Docs.summary: Configures the property(s) to use as the foreign key for this relationship.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: If is not specified, then an attempt will be made to match the data type and order of foreign key properties against the primary key of the principal entity type. If they do not match, new shadow state properties that form a unique index will be added to the principal entity type to serve as the reference key. A shadow state property is one that does not have a corresponding property in the entity class. The current value for the property is stored in the rather than being stored in instances of the entity class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<TPrincipalEntity,TDependentEntity> HasForeignKey (params string[] foreignKeyPropertyNames);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder`2<!TPrincipalEntity, !TDependentEntity> HasForeignKey(string[] foreignKeyPropertyNames) cil managed
Public Overridable Function HasForeignKey (ParamArray foreignKeyPropertyNames As String()) As ReferenceCollectionBuilder(Of TPrincipalEntity, TDependentEntity)

override this.HasForeignKey : string[] -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<'PrincipalEntity, 'DependentEntity (requires 'PrincipalEntity : null and 'DependentEntity : null)>

Docs.param: The name(s) of the foreign key property(s).
Docs.summary: Configures the property(s) to use as the foreign key for this relationship.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

remarks.para: If the specified property name(s) do not exist on the entity type then a new shadow state property(s) will be added to serve as the foreign key. A shadow state property is one that does not have a corresponding property in the entity class. The current value for the property is stored in the rather than being stored in instances of the entity class.

If is not specified, then an attempt will be made to match the data type and order of foreign key properties against the primary key of the principal entity type. If they do not match, new shadow state properties that form a unique index will be added to the principal entity type to serve as the reference key.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<TPrincipalEntity,TDependentEntity> HasPrincipalKey (System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<TPrincipalEntity,object>> keyExpression);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder`2<!TPrincipalEntity, !TDependentEntity> HasPrincipalKey(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<!TPrincipalEntity, object>> keyExpression) cil managed
Public Overridable Function HasPrincipalKey (keyExpression As Expression(Of Func(Of TPrincipalEntity, Object))) As ReferenceCollectionBuilder(Of TPrincipalEntity, TDependentEntity)

override this.HasPrincipalKey : System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<'PrincipalEntity, obj>> -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<'PrincipalEntity, 'DependentEntity (requires 'PrincipalEntity : null and 'DependentEntity : null)>

public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.ReferenceCollectionBuilder<TPrincipalEntity,TDependentEntity> HasPrincipalKey (System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<TPrincipalEntity,object?>> keyExpression);

param.name: keyExpression
param.para: A lambda expression representing the referenced key property(s) (blog => blog.BlogId).

If the principal key is made up of multiple properties then specify an anonymous type including the properties (t => new { t.Id1, t.Id2 }). The order specified should match the order of corresponding properties in .

Docs.summary: Configures the unique property(s) that this relationship targets. Typically you would only call this method if you want to use a property(s) other than the primary key as the principal property(s). If the specified property(s) is not already a unique constraint (or the primary key) then a new unique constraint will be introduced.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.
